t: John 8
But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
An Adulteress Forgiven
At*p dawn he went to the temple again, and all the people were coming to him. He sat down and began to teach them.
Then*p the scribes and the Pharisees brought a woman caught in adultery, making her stand in the center.
“Teacher,” they said to him, “this woman was caught in the act of committing adultery.
In the law Moses commanded us to stone such women. So what do you say?”
They asked this to trap him, in order that they might have evidence to accuse him. Jesus*p stooped down and started writing on the ground with his finger.
When they persisted in questioning him, he stood up and said to them, “The*r one*r without*r sin*r among*r you*r should*r be*r the*r first*r to*r throw*r a*r stone*r at*r her.”*r
Then he stooped down again and continued writing on the ground.
When they heard this, they left one by one, starting with the older men. Only he was left, with the woman in the center.
When Jesus stood up, he said to her, “Woman,*r where*r are*r they?*r Has*r no*r one*r condemned*r you?”*r
“No*p one, Lord,” she answered. “Neither*rp do*r I*r condemn*r you,”*r said Jesus. “Go,*r and*r from*r now*r on*r do*r not*r sin*r anymore.”]*r
The Light of the World
Jesus*p spoke to them again: “I*r am*r the*r light*r of*r the*r world.*r Anyone*r who*r follows*r me*r will*r never*r walk*r in*r the*r darkness*r but*r will*r have*r the*r light*r of*r life.”*r
So*p the Pharisees said to him, “You are testifying about yourself. Your testimony is not valid.”

“Even*rp if*r I*r testify*r about*r myself,”*r Jesus replied, “My*r testimony*r is*r true,*r because*r I*r know*r where*r I*r came*r from*r and*r where*r I’m*r going.*r But*r you*r don’t*r know*r where*r I*r come*r from*r or*r where*r I’m*r going.*r
You*r judge*r by*r human*r standards.*r I*r judge*r no*r one.*r
And*r if*r I*r do*r judge,*r my*r judgment*r is*r true,*r because*r it*r is*r not*r I*r alone*r who*r judge,*r but*r I*r and*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r me.*r
Even*r in*r your*r law*r it*r is*r written*r that*r the*r testimony*r of*r two*r witnesses*r is*r true.*r
I*r am*r the*r one*r who*r testifies*r about*r myself,*r and*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r me*r testifies*r about*r me.”*r
Then*p they asked him, “Where is your Father?” “You*rp know*r neither*r me*r nor*r my*r Father,”*r Jesus answered. “If*r you*r knew*r me,*r you*r would*r also*r know*r my*r Father.”*r
He spoke these words by the treasury, while teaching in the temple. But no one seized him, because his hour had not yet come.
Jesus Predicts His Departure
Then*p he said to them again, “I’m*r going*r away;*r you*r will*r look*r for*r me,*r and*r you*r will*r die*r in*r your*r sin.*r Where*r I’m*r going,*r you*r cannot*r come.”*r
So*p the Jews said again, “He won’t kill himself, will he, since he says, ‘Where*r I’m*r going,*r you*r cannot*r come’?”*r
“You*rp are*r from*r below,”*r he told them, “I*r am*r from*r above.*r You*r are*r of*r this*r world;*r I*r am*r not*r of*r this*r world.*r
Therefore*r I*r told*r you*r that*r you*r will*r die*r in*r your*r sins.*r For*r if*r you*r do*r not*r believe*r that*r I*r am*r he,*r you*r will*r die*r in*r your*r sins.”*r
“Who*p are you?” they questioned. “Exactly*rp what*r I’ve*r been*r telling*r you*r from*r the*r very*r beginning,”*r Jesus told them.

“I*r have*r many*r things*r to*r say*r and*r to*r judge*r about*r you,*r but*r the*r one*r who*r sent*r me*r is*r true,*r and*r what*r I*r have*r heard*r from*r him -*r these*r things*r I*r tell*r the*r world.”*r
They*p did not know he was speaking to them about the Father.

So Jesus said to them, “When*r you*r lift*r up*r the*r Son*r of*r Man,*r then*r you*r will*r know*r that*r I*r am*r he,*r and*r that*r I*r do*r nothing*r on*r my*r own.*r But*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r taught*r me,*r I*r say*r these*r things.*r
The*r one*r who*r sent*r me*r is*r with*r me.*r He*r has*r not*r left*r me*r alone,*r because*r I*r always*r do*r what*r pleases*r him.”*r
Truth and Freedom
As*p he was saying these things, many believed in him.
Then*p Jesus said to the Jews who had believed him, “If*r you*r continue*r in*r my*r word,*r you*r really*r are*r my*r disciples.*r
You*r will*r know*r the*r truth,*r and*r the*r truth*r will*r set*r you*r free.”*r
“We*p are descendants of Abraham,” they answered him, “and we have never been enslaved to anyone. How can you say, ‘You*r will*r become*r free’?”*r
Jesus*p responded, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r everyone*r who*r commits*r sin*r is*r a*r slave*r of*r sin.*r
A*r slave*r does*r not*r remain*r in*r the*r household*r forever,*r but*r a*r son*r does*r remain*r forever.*r
So*r if*r the*r Son*r sets*r you*r free,*r you*r really*r will*r be*r free.*r
I*r know*r you*r are*r descendants*r of*r Abraham,*r but*r you*r are*r trying*r to*r kill*r me*r because*r my*r word*r has*r no*r place*r among*r you.*r
I*r speak*r what*r I*r have*r seen*r in*r the*r presence*r of*r the*r Father;*r so*r then,*r you*r do*r what*r you*r have*r heard*r from*r your*r father.”*r
“Our*p father is Abraham,” they replied. “If*rp you*r were*r Abraham’s*r children,”*r Jesus told them, “you*r would*r do*r what*r Abraham*r did.*r
But*r now*r you*r are*r trying*r to*r kill*r me,*r a*r man*r who*r has*r told*r you*r the*r truth*r that*r I*r heard*r from*r God.*r Abraham*r did*r not*r do*r this.*r
You’re*r doing*r what*r your*r father*r does.”*r “We*p weren’t born of sexual immorality,” they said. “We have one Father - God.”

Jesus*p said to them, “If*r God*r were*r your*r Father,*r you*r would*r love*r me,*r because*r I*r came*r from*r God*r and*r I*r am*r here.*r For*r I*r didn’t*r come*r on*r my*r own,*r but*r he*r sent*r me.*r
Why*r don’t*r you*r understand*r what*r I*r say?*r Because*r you*r cannot*r listen*r to*r my*r word.*r

You*r are*r of*r your*r father*r the*r devil,*r and*r you*r want*r to*r carry*r out*r your*r father’s*r desires.*r He*r was*r a*r murderer*r from*r the*r beginning*r and*r does*r not*r stand*r in*r the*r truth,*r because*r there*r is*r no*r truth*r in*r him.*r When*r he*r tells*r a*r lie,*r he*r speaks*r from*r his*r own*r nature,*r because*r he*r is*r a*r liar*r and*r the*r father*r of*r lies.*r
Yet*r because*r I*r tell*r the*r truth,*r you*r do*r not*r believe*r me.*r
Who*r among*r you*r can*r convict*r me*r of*r sin?*r If*r I*r am*r telling*r the*r truth,*r why*r don’t*r you*r believe*r me?*r
The*r one*r who*r is*r from*r God*r listens*r to*r God’s*r words.*r This*r is*r why*r you*r don’t*r listen,*r because*r you*r are*r not*r from*r God.”*r
Jesus and Abraham
The*p Jews responded to him, “Aren’t we right in saying that you’re a Samaritan and have a demon?”
“I*rp do*r not*r have*r a*r demon,”*r Jesus answered. “On*r the*r contrary,*r I*r honor*r my*r Father*r and*r you*r dishonor*r me.*r
I*r do*r not*r seek*r my*r own*r glory;*r there*r is*r one*r who*r seeks*r it*r and*r judges.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r if*r anyone*r keeps*r my*r word,*r he*r will*r never*r see*r death.”*r
Then*p the Jews said, “Now we know you have a demon. Abraham died and so did the prophets. You say, ‘If*r anyone*r keeps*r my*r word,*r he*r will*r never*r taste*r death.’*r
Are you greater than our father Abraham who died? And the prophets died. Who do you claim to be?”
“If*rp I*r glorify*r myself,”*r Jesus answered, “my*r glory*r is*r nothing.*r My*r Father -*r about*r whom*r you*r say,*r ‘He*r is*r our*r God’ -*r he*r is*r the*r one*r who*r glorifies*r me.*r

You*r do*r not*r know*r him,*r but*r I*r know*r him.*r If*r I*r were*r to*r say*r I*r don’t*r know*r him,*r I*r would*r be*r a*r liar*r like*r you.*r But*r I*r do*r know*r him,*r and*r I*r keep*r his*r word.*r
Your*r father*r Abraham*r rejoiced*r to*r see*r my*r day;*r he*r saw*r it*r and*r was*r glad.”*r
The*p Jews replied, “You aren’t fifty years old yet, and you’ve seen Abraham?”
Jesus*p said to them, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r before*r Abraham*r was,*r I*r am.”*r
So*p they picked up stones to throw at him. But Jesus was hidden and went out of the temple.
